Showrooming Wars


Here's an interesting twist to "Showrooming <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109315675866&s=8442&e=0014WA0TKs_e_VOMGQ0YOGr4vjBiNydw-U0bhCn4blRX3ayZlMTgIhuozSfSzkf7gIRR6XuEZUR1T1ZWen6ZAFH1tdBP5tnxBE9dgbKPXUHypkP4mzbi-E5WpkC1GBtALZ2QOgqHpYuYwcSIfhOxc_q7wCMTklwZLf-U0EAZ7-7wQzhhXpsu8WCK-X1BgwxzvNTQ7Qjmg7Lw9lcC44k2aoMWBb3ZWWLl0kYyCTGP1bTaQ8=> " which has recently come to light as brick-and-mortar retailers have tired of potential customers viewing products in-store and buying elsewhere - usually via online retailers. Retailigence says in a press release that it wants to help your local retailer be "everywhere consumers are" as the company announced partnerships with two local shopping apps. Retailigence CEO Jeremy Geiger says in the release, "Mobile consumers use a variety of apps; retailers that get in front of shoppers demonstrating an immediate need benefit from greater awareness and proven boosts in local sales." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109315675866&s=8442&e=0014WA0TKs_e_WwF927ihpjUY_OgeuYpOQoaN0DbV6gyWh6HwOIIQFZEDjbqDN9h9PdwDqBSO3f5hUNzLgsIUimboOdqjsSgPnct78pIE7OrHM4FFtoFGunYUCDESfUtICwj1o6faBW1oW9kyDvf07-dvq8mdFqjO86vjhK7L3BiEk_q2RVkBr0lz7agTr6HKaLVGeJzAnyhPeW9gE67BsbGSiiSaiqzszqIALa1fL3A92xVS1bo1ajFw==> . Corner stores <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109315675866&s=8442&e=0014WA0TKs_e_UIxlG_pL0fVIFuNcy6a-Ah1cyJtn_LS8Pkc6Tg-RJWpijGDk58ur7mU810szr-gwYiGN_ZOW6YmhcD11nUPLCrQ3RbKYrGmOVG2ztxybf9BWs45nOTFf8s4hKhBzcKrIPkSWe9ZnQnnbVAeD29rHcVQJCuyswbpMQ=>  fulfill the "immediate need...." Google <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109315675866&s=8442&e=0014WA0TKs_e_VCpLh9VFv6XLcoYp5cLT0J2GWBa4zL5IbmJJVu_ZcvEg4_os96_WHrjJqe13Qvzsn0QQGUb7PA5GKlsfMNR4M0ON2aL-VHYaOzai3vuSG8E9oEQFrFC62wwn2_q4iDMUqkpYxzXRhXtV71snfFcaEkCAQNspFfE5aIfO38OeDlmnHZbyIPCmSUdvUGJiodpZpfXXq6CLL71ftC7DYhWMRBegrkUo7tF3k=>  and Amazon <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109315675866&s=8442&e=0014WA0TKs_e_VlodZoS4MkftlGSidx-WKQewqEwQ2FD28Sl2Cvd3j9uiNXmgx1UT8S-b0-4lTx__BVRtSEkHJdLarXUxUGKdgAjP69tBYtVVGvYXEid_3ChUvSII3xw1aEg77WwGHNhcp3yJflQsi7Wrq21XCfs9qWkFT1B1fUBFzASw42Z3xCn2lMX0QrgZ9nzLaTc_qQVsailktK_EyWkmDZHvpOkwv1>  are just getting started with their own "immediate need" initiatives, while Apple is a machine with stores for its own branded products. 


The Predictive World


The New York Times has published an excerpt of Charles Duhigg <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109315675866&s=8442&e=0014WA0TKs_e_UaapqlyxNzxf4G4O5B51WfXCmfTtDKLRSFOJyZ-Yp7BkavrAqw7zzql-RjZMI5I1kMq7vHOAQTX3_vyxvFgfW3z1pLaAVB1aI5eDq_5K5a0g==> 's "The Power of Habit: Why We Do What We Do in Life and Business" for The New York Times Magazine. In the excerpt, the story of Target statistician Andrew Pole is the lead as the retailer's marketers ask him to help predict - through the use of the retailer's consumer data - when a woman is pregnant "even if she didn't want us to know," and therefore provide her offers for relevant products. Duhigg quotes Andreas Weigend, the former chief scientist at Amazon.com, who notes the importance of data to many companies these days, "It's like an arms race to hire statisticians nowadays. Mathematicians are suddenly sexy." At its core, this article is about privacy, predictability, human habits, the power of retargeting - and that the "data cat" is out of the bag. Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109315675866&s=8442&e=0014WA0TKs_e_UKzwtneoKW7c2bp1Y8gg31Qn0bQwZhx-AxCQhADrWQAdsTmSLFhU_Y6gPE1LKr5ZLRvJIKvnu08QpsTqLaozBLss25o_fvsvFiJ_HKhjaxIIIYAUZlTjCbesbwEjEBZKAiO39cFLSdvm_v19iNj1PB5wxbuFSVqSSaX8hpLKAnyA==> . Felix Salmon comments on the article from his Reuters blog, "If you're pessimistically inclined, the breathtaking implications are negative. On the other hand, there are lots of positive potential implications, too." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109315675866&s=8442&e=0014WA0TKs_e_Vo-VIYzPOmOkFEyiNw9zlOPLEyZZWn8u18hmLIecJZo62bC3n7No1e4NgRW5YFmfbRr8tfIGmzF7HW6t-ZDeV_etoR3K1hOpnRl7VYdjCk2C0IHuSQHAwzPWA2P-wiPk4T6D1EZ53Qupni7dW6ABJyQdnFoqduiJuNbm6vkNebo7LT129xlOOd> . 


Carrigan Speaks


On strategy+business, Bob Carrigan, CEO of IDG Communications and the U.S. IAB's Chairman, submits to a detailed interview regarding his thoughts on ... strategy and business! Among other talking points, Carrigan dons his IAB cape and comments on whether there is a need to standardize mobile ad units - the idea being that publishers, who are looking to attract mobile ad dollars, can offer standardization and thus scale to marketers. He tells s+b, "It's going to be challenging for publishers to figure out where to invest their resources. The IAB has not moved too rapidly to freeze advertising standards for mobile devices, because it's still early days. We want to let things percolate." Read it all <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109315675866&s=8442&e=0014WA0TKs_e_WLFYb_8KsiH7plzNdtd_lHPhlauHS_upM-QubnGKcYH-QKbwCQV-To4nCZpuU2KoybZWT8vagimzbQeg96MjKd1N78pOaY6ZMLnZ7nbb7dg2wTebt30QxpGK3NYrfO-JlwCuypsNQOoodxA2UHIs9A> . 


Owning Advertising


On iMedia Connection, TRAFFIQ's Eric Picard wonders aloud if Facebook can put various silos of ad dollars to work in an opinion piece. Picard is very positive on Facebook's opportunity overall. As it relates to brand ads, he writes, "So Facebook could own brand advertising online, could own a role as the authoritative data provider for brand advertising, could own the way that the big brand content platform of TV makes its way into a more modern and effective ad model, and could very well be the winner of the online advertising (nay the entire advertising) space for brands." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109315675866&s=8442&e=0014WA0TKs_e_WF6CFnlLz7RmLEqmCx4yRMWQJB105-HfXRrADbLGUzpr6_IkKLbBUfq4-DsWBUEHZuSePGYmtAuVpNsU-qqACBJnzbEIjywnbEyKlamQtJAH6SUUH7rSx_1aipR_PeMRvoSCgpcmMWezkUmDqWTtgjnenBYmBA7z0=> . 


$100 Million In Local Ads


ReachLocal which is targeting SMBs with local ads solutions says that it made $100 million in the 4th quarter -essentially breaking even and meeting Wall Street estimates. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109315675866&s=8442&e=0014WA0TKs_e_XivvK8pt1y8ux7N715u0z2voxrnvmVgElVTsRpMeXhlot8gZF6tZOpk91i_f747YsACT1kqj42nkYm1zAgyF7XjioMrknkpOnPfEsGJo-C5s3sVACqK-j8511PRbjCLl1f-uuZWPQynq0BfTvJ4SlzlHI00edcpsgWkvHGyKkMJuINhJz_5YJ_mB5eTOY3TGJ6Kgr427-9XjvDMsV5qrzFwT6hZcHMhk0=> . Citi analyst Mark Mahaney reviews the results for investors and is positive, "Long Thesis remains: 1) Local 'Net Advertising is as a material hyper-growth market opportunity ($60B); 2) ReachLocal is one of the leaders in addressing this segment; 3) ReachLocal's salesforce-intensive approach actually makes the model moaty; & 4) Modest but consistent EBITDA ramp supports long-term margin expansion. Biggest risks are competition, high churn, and execution."

Digital Upfront


Online content providers Google, Yahoo, Hulu, AOL and Microsoft, among others, are taking the proverbial bull by the horns and producing their own "Upfront" in April says The Wall Street Journal's Suzanne Vranica. "The event is dubbed 'Digital Content New Fronts,' a not-so-subtle reference to the 'upfront' name for television's week of glitzy presentations and lavish parties. The upfront is a prelude to weeks of negotiations with advertisers about purchase of ad time for the coming fall season." Read it (subscription) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109315675866&s=8442&e=0014WA0TKs_e_VvLYiBwYP6WZi9Aw0Sf9zpfkcj3DH8vwKMc2hIVhdk_WiV7U7DP24fJIwhyRL4E-C_rIeFxnZbCJyFfZXrW-KweqkcnLHV4FAYUhry2Tlb1qSanhBBvvWyOG1sAJ1gOeXjODKTI1df_1_O_Xii4KWGEVlhWg1Zd_h2lx-qmjB6Q9fsuoOuXnvspjM4uMz5x4lrMyEUlR9w1T97P0rBRvbnUv91TdTSiWU=> .


When Attending A Show


Doug Weaver delivers recommendations for the seller crowd on his company's "Get The Drift" blog. With the trade show business in full-tilt from now until July, Weaver's recommendations resonate - including #5 (of 6): "Ask Questions that Mean Something. When meeting someone at a trade event, be prepared with a question that will spark a real conversation. "What's on the agenda you don't want to miss?" And, don't ask "Are you a DSP?" because of course they are! Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109315675866&s=8442&e=0014WA0TKs_e_U1zUwW6eUb-Gn0bn1RNZynyrlEdLCnIFO_ZmZbpVzdIS5UR3WAKgZ66J50Pjy4a7IokojuCqBtm0JrOy5qQ69a0bRslTIppqxQ_shF_7UxwMKtYv9vawlUF8kqtbMxVdBVgjvb6LkmMA==> .

DG's MediaMind Future


Convergence is coming - or is it just plain ol' digital? HD ad prices have dropped a lot more than many have expected according to Wall Street analysts on DG's earnings call yesterday. HD ads are a key part of DG's TV business. Also, DG CEO Neil Nguyen says trends with his company's financials indicate brand budgets are moving away from spot TV which is resulting in guiding DG's strategy towards online led by its MediaMind unit. TV revenues will increase only in the "single digits" in 2012 stated the company - where digital will experience "double-digit" growth. DG also offered a quick anecdote that a soft December was reflected by others in ad tech with whom DG had done a "channel check." The $44 million of DG's Q4 online revenue was flat when compared to 2010 as MediaMind grew and Eyewonder was a drag on a revenue basis. (Eyewonder and Unicast are now under the MediaMind brand.) TV revenues slipped from 69 to 64 million in Q4. The company has roughly $400 million in debt which it used to fuel its recent acquisition spree. Read the earnings release - which includes a profit for Q4 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109306243155&s=8442&e=001xchWCyzqtqXLxR7Z9UrytjfY-9Sh-u4rsH3QFBM3giOOOzOkOBVbhuvKNsSOEgXQoBRb19YJIzKag8LmAW_0uuH-4PtBo26NvpUCUSqThAG5nqe_CcrzPBozJ_-iAZX1jkYItXZqscIMTOWgXWvbjmTLyDrA_XDBtoW5w6to7E_eMTMcHLUvvq-LHS_UvG5ZkMMkHIh5QWfmSD2UpbXD7AfuzoYzidWKVY_mH8YpKLI=> . MediaMind GM and Chief Digital Officer of DG Gal Trifon made an appearance on the earnings call. Among highlights Trifon offered is emphasis, not surprisingly, on MediaMind's video ad serving business. When the analysts took over on the call (the call lasted over an hour!), questions ranged on why the TV business is lagging to what can be expected by digital down the road in the next 3 or 4 years. Trifon talked up the data-driven future for DG, too, saying that DG's business will eventually not be so much about delivering ads to businesses (HD and TV distribution hubs) but direct to the consumer. Also announced - CFO Omar Choucair is leaving the company. 


AOR Morphing


The Wall Street Journal's Suzanne Vranica reports on the acquisition of an agency by a PR firm - independent NYC agency Strawberry Frog by Washington D.C.-based APCO Worldwide. Vranica writes, "Increasingly being charged with helping marketers manage their social media marketing, PR firms are now finding themselves having to make creative content for marketers." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109306243155&s=8442&e=001xchWCyzqtqUaJvszU3BvY6lAHHW7SbP_uFdbMFajjQaSHQBtfM18H0qsQ1vTFXHZS4OcVDh4Z5gcmCJJB9adaGDIHyXvbzFf9ricK4f0ddap32YgEoWxJlosmHBcHklxdM7qAr6sEAExryBd2bcMPQAaZL2c493m3-9M-McmmndisX_0JGE4jfHE5pWlPtN9> . Could the agency business that current ad tech companies manage lead to agency-of-record opportunities? GSI Commerce's interactive agency (which became GSI/eBay's True Action Network) became digital AOR for Toys'R;Us and Dick's Sporting Goods" a couple of years ago <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109306243155&s=8442&e=001xchWCyzqtqUfqOhWcQGUzVG3naGAx3cMAWWTYLHLCpW3vUYDYEVO_TbgFvYAsEm3yj7GORTszhaXBaIfZXFg_aGLTqsTMxVjWQflsLeM_Erh6BhXPcgS58l2-6D8RZOtSoXJ_5Kf2v0e8MOH5KLJlA==> . No doubt some ad tech firms are avoiding the AOR moniker for now in fear of hurting valuations with the perception of being an agency. How long can that last until pouring business through increasingly undifferentiated technology overwhelms the public-facing tech positioning? 


Video Next For Adchemy?


Adchemy announced that it has added former Delve Networks <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109306243155&s=8442&e=001xchWCyzqtqUbk9qq2fm_gjCIH4Hhuqg-JPJPZ60lDPfk8FyncmfXxaaEnsDsrEcOytXYm1nNf0jC8UbbFLaNcgbQHIn3WxV1LUz2ck-emJ4kBzs53CbyGdkhIphGExcq_X3HZ5mcxR7C9OSHYMN5Iw==>  CEO Alex Castro as its VP of Product Strategy and Management. Delve Networks was acquired by Limelight Networks in 2010 <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109306243155&s=8442&e=001xchWCyzqtqU_p349w2PXlBOBissX2ilXRjVlkb0I-VIwjMmaV9ADRH_m964Q9WM4qKgQs3Hn6zz54SNtRQBPHyQozsNojzMA3y80fA0pwXfffJug88pOLGPG04V7JiRl34hvlBxRs7fwTzv0h7yuf32g3LSezc4__4q9ou-hPhtU0eDJNevrHKImsQGegp5LhWcg9KIJzgIuwLyFpigvzcoBVpum1laJBVc0liaaJTlEDT6DkPDDc-ZvXHIf2_nbtgdW3OfMZiF4SPbT1Dyi2QKtLxmKpERo> . Given that Castro's Delve experience was about "focusing on online video hosting and 'search inside' video technology" (according to a 2009 interview <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109306243155&s=8442&e=001xchWCyzqtqXYpvPj1j6AT9YFTUEjvSTWceJABvSVaDmA8X3ju3SB6kadmRk_ZD4lXchuk62vAvLWj6bpM2a0ykVf85z2ZLZRzSKSDeB5IMyELucEIyfgxm2yaa2kx6J1v-Sn-8BrbcNDvIRoq57U8ZlTSm1AxeF0a-QedPgDS4FpQ8sVkqBcTNVbEYYy_P16Th7bvAMgLhbxNgKXj9eFxt5H2WhaUNYjrazWg7I8GwI=> ), it may follow that Adchemy CEO Murthy Nukala will extend his company's IntentMap search targeting solution to video. The Adchemy press release goes on to say that the company is making hiring a top priority in 2012. Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109306243155&s=8442&e=001xchWCyzqtqXUTA52pN6nXpHVGsdpAE20rWCKoR2Y-8ajmJimsipvzBIcCSoV3kUd192ZIUDQRFn3IivD38e2I80nb6UGRkRe5CZAuIKg4sVIsQvRf3Ig0bX5EUm4nnSSTuI_F5k3jrnXWzGSvxN2cICoAVOKp6YTiYYebEw9k8YMr2rUJrGehBK8uVihdVA9Val1t44CgIq0fT1PJHojWHZi8U5ZYnDwDhXpQVsnDiZLmkYN-vJyyW1KOeqJlyEMFfvBROoeZn4=>  


Stop Nesting iFrames


The IAB released its ad verification guidelines as the industry org aims to get its arms, and the industry's, around how ad verification should be properly implemented. A sample guideline: "Ad verification vendors have procedures to classify and report whether advertising served into iFrames from other domains has been appropriately executed. In addition, the general nature of the verification tools used to view iFrame content should be disclosed. Moreover, it is recommended that the industry minimize the use of nested iFrames." Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109306243155&s=8442&e=001xchWCyzqtqUaIA2BHNWsxfVZ0TaxRa7MdTi0MzkjBS4xIp4xHkFWPhXweb7cv6D2nheuCeceuLi0WPgoNVHNh4Tl0EDivd8na0h12hQJXD3uWKCaVNBPYONuJKqMRGJxSQ9LpYUPk9nrrYd0JsGR0VxQLwouARU93tRLUYx0v0abIO9GHGl3WOfwesPBjNpmpkbQJ0teE6IakPHZs6iFqRFudVFNzZQN> . And download the guidelines <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109306243155&s=8442&e=001xchWCyzqtqWy2chaF0ML4zd8ZSd4lhGhVQfJDErp3EeifUFhCkVrpwFhCLHOHQ4_Qg6FiJ_Qqh4liAPCQUOUp76pzma_7C5Khal1W4p73j62xOVXOzOGT-zDmotiz8YA> . 


Measuring Ad Value


Jarvis Mak, who is ad network Rocket Fuel's VP of analytics, tells readers on iMedia connection that a single ad interaction metric is no reason to not work with a vendor. He supports a more holistic view using several metrics including LTV - the lifetime value of acquired customers. Mak writes, "For direct response advertisers, especially in finance and retail, customers acquired cheaply are often low-value customers, especially when promotions are involved. The value of more expensive leads (as measured by account balances or subsequent basket size and purchase frequency) ends up much higher than cheaper direct response leads. An agency that is maniacally focused on low CPA without regard to LTV is doing their advertiser a disservice." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109306243155&s=8442&e=001xchWCyzqtqWY5yfJux1JbtnTPWHWHjMAvdOA6xIGcn8ruh_kjPVBVYA4GrYiipZgWyG26wsOjo-LxxdcXnywXjGJ9-kpieHDZvtC3hS73T1qwhi7mQfwIeb8gt4udgMWU0IAenammmYQWwGFkgqkU1oHs8BYjF_quIcYmdSBAEI=> .

Earnings Rating Point


Yesterday, comScore reported earnings showing a slight lost for Q4 2011. See the release (PDF) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109306243155&s=8442&e=001xchWCyzqtqWySSq_-4csVZLMpROINlyJDQHT6FLL61uNKGvXPSSlkl-_jR5xcgOrJ5UHKjiGj7cFy8rr2PgrCpyAsu2OQHEB2X5u5qXJXcfYnc-NodMD_Rt7xwCrWWi6GEVWNWqN0RcX9U2uSNC8I-Sha3eS9w7ve216osKgCgHxUry5YCdKDqTziYugYPMwtwXwPmKOl8onHpfG-lv0jlx38IkkxpuCuC5ZuGM22rInTwYI6wwaBD3IzaEa2U_OYm9yU5D0b_MkJ4L-pqbnOSUXZZjfTeU6fdHjxRtVHis=> . ThinkEquity analyst Robert Coolbrith took note, "[comScore] reported a generally in-line 4Q11 but guided slightly below consensus and well below our forecast for FY12 as investments in growth will continue and revenue growth will be more muted in 1H12, to be followed by a back-half growth acceleration." Even though comScore was below some of his estimates, Coolbrith thinks comScore is a "core holding." comScore CEO Dr. Magid Abraham stated in the release that new products hold the key to growth, "On a quarterly basis, we anticipate that growing adoption of newer products such as Digital Analytix, and validated Campaign Essentials will drive accelerating year-over-year growth as we progress through the year."

*	Wednesday, February 15, News Round-Up <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS5TVCmpNyhyXjg3MCc32th5NVSJGTYeKraN2KSwhI8gFv4tbI3Jc7_iKW73ogbo9onFTa-vUwEJtIFJuD3Boh1PErmN7LfbnXFJCU5_d0JRtJ4YgnEE4VmHpPBhhWZEn0G9_C6ACoiPQ4koUruAiYFfur7F1Nqr5j0=>  (see below)
*	Microsoft Adding Social To Brand Display Ads For Guaranteed And Non-Guaranteed Inventory Says GM Creegan <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS4xshc8QF3iY07WRdRSz1M9p9ccWwQFh8n7tbXJzrw_Tfnkv3j-eOV2JIkZSShOSYL6JDXeTNTweWi9ZU2OOIB7_D3Oom7qUGsSQDif0rpAUs1Sg_F9SCFPl32aSYtIENO-NW-xG38yr7o0Hwg4icWAiiSv8capU1665rjMIwsbfQ==>   "The way we think about it is as a brand canvas where you bring the brand message into it the way you would any display advertising. Then you marry that with the content that comes through our partnership with Bazaarvoice. On top of that, you decide where you're going to serve it." (visit AdExchanger.com) 
*	CEO Moukas Says Velti Blending Advertising And Marketing Across Mobile <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS5pPvo-bO2NWFvbCU7e--_pWOsAjJ48YEAEUdfb4u07ayqSnOCGnAe1ko0FngLTRK5N9REu505vukC2TELqJKFrZksngPjJBI0ZncecQmNjcsZgfKk4xoNcbEFN--rMv2MqgKXbTsSHiukoLXEsDbYI>   "The other dimension is regulatory. On the web, you can work off a quasi-single datacenter. In mobile, you have specific regulations, which are local regulations. Within the EU, personal and travel data would need to be in service within EU borders with signup behind their firewalls. With Russia, not really, but if want to do business there, you have to be there. It's much more nuanced, which means that it's a technology problem..."(visit AdExchanger.com) 
*	Are The Olympics The Best Prism For Understanding Cross-Platform Viewing And Ad Effectiveness? <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS6LBIbP1f_RXLcpWhmtoPoegfoMur6Qiu9kcanEdGKJBhFSQCtku0HMbUKojiRS2oCrklkNTHyY7x8UbvTWCS7Qn_ThS5ib0uwwNVkCwEbAUN09TSA7XP1JqTjNRLDFKsZ8SZf8sZILZ6I6Q4Gi-Bpd1OZvCkJvBFEWtW24zJYdcX5eXtiqwc0H3a8IT8CbT8Mzap2XkMc-Dd3_yHIa2Jls01Q7Tanx25HtsqxrdAMSW76NZT-ziUX6n86qaf6waLA1qJSDgB6Dog==>  (visit TVexchanger.com)

Bluelight Special


In Ad Age, Kunur Patel writes that the iAd costs are being slashed again - now you can have your very own iAd running through the iPhone and Ipad for the starting cost of $100,000 - was $1 million. Patel adds, "In addition, app developers will receive 70% of ad revenues from iAds running on their apps, vs. their previous 60% cut. The extra money will compensate for lower ad rates and serve as added incentive for developers to build businesses on Apple devices..." Marketshare wars! Read more including the end of some wacky CPC <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS5NvWWVJC8hTVC_BGaE2o9mQfcYNGK8N2KkLopw6SXFRJmfy4cuOQtgayn-GBILAvbRbQePf39kDVEsFwZ4BNk8kGzbxOK3MIAB_a8MEAg473ova6ZWsH1LxSW8t2m7rgP5kSpQDr8U6g0SRTeco6YUEjlm5CrMxvS_f7Pb1R3G7BMwPFpRYHV2CBDdu4tO_D9GL0iTyKyb5A==> +CPM combo pricing for the iAd. 


Ad Network Report


The Network Advertising Initiative (NAI) released its annual compliance study yesterday and if visits to the NAI opt-out website are any indication, online behavioral advertising is garnering a lot of interest - traffic more than doubled to 6 million unique visits in 2011. Adweek's Katy Bachmann notes <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS7SQebaHl-ewMOg3AngIbut-aGd8haK0DNmhsTmRXxCr79xEzr5rC04RBa7EzLaflFPYAXfvlXwWUwM9atmhicRlzKGk2RWleIQp32R8FiwNEbWKjyUX5_VfVEPZzajNjsJi9VezcCbM5vZItA_jEI687L7qUzPEH7EkEAHuATw2o2kkyIYfmm4a85E76oIzya9IhSlIW-TMQ==>  that this report marks a "coming-out party" for NAI chief Marc Groman who used to work as the FTC's chief privacy officer. Download it (PDF) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS4vQ0d0Q0tnjid-GcQqF_k4qOUnc5zHMqu_B27ohFO5olSjAsbWrvW75b0KYS7YyF5pnCdlAV1ese9jm8424bjPukbY8Wj6XuSq8EIH6Ho_rWXBdSrWly88RiF_prtgsglXkINrt0EtMU3jxgEzOTN6I0qJ-NnIjlKMLSIXMelQGA==> . 


Game Ads


Boo-coo ad dollars are floating around in the world of online casual games. Zynga knows first-hand. According to the now-public company, Zynga reported that in Q4 2011 it had "Advertising revenue of $74.5 million, an increase of 226% on a year-over-year basis." That's about 25% of Zynga's overall revenue of $306 million in Q4. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS5Fkw_hi9hjP1l2gG6Uk69rBL8VpRNMKxMTLgijZA1zAziqC6NoWa_MnNcKtPU_k0E8yVrTv3a-ZPWfTdQFhrD1PbRd9D_8z_NR_hXtWUUUnGVWEHw9m8fBrHIvtyc3hBhwtShH5ksrj5VXdVWU11bAnRubimDNdMKlSBPkbHIiggol7X8XXY0ko0VkEJAk9knwH9Ltn2M2XIy0rKRTegik> . Can they continue to scale ad budgets through engagement ads such as those provided by companies like SocialVibe <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS4P8ztrAvr2Q98WxIbpsOws1eTLkNQrANH2WlMQZKV7wmiX8tWaS9s4tUATg_MPmqg7Zboz7OgQkVytq9XpwvlqulpJDlfRsFYhKhNOaIKZg5SniAffALlwaKW_h8PBJWS6hf5aS9NG2Bfz7Q7T2s2qL-dj9VCNFwrnLiXP8mQVTfKmmeHuWClp> , was SV Network (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS6248TUBUsHVhsI-yUsE6wOkNtaOeXQ7aoq3bm4yZpKREGXawiF6YTvx9bwwahUHMbirynhpmq4t497y6VmcaxFzzomS1IAe7NtDpCffO6hHyD79pqkHjF7cCgrQiz0IoapOmQvWPc7Ub06N8Ao_xXYByVZty1aTOJrCZ_43sR05MjDEeNVZ8fqDlAgG_QHze2GVIFl_YxjKXgUCz3tEktjrsGeXd7QJM7N5rxqvl1S3Q==> &A from 2010)? 


Agency Holding Profits


Agency holding company Omnicom reported its Q4 2011 results and thing appear headed in the right direction as earnings grew 10% and revenue increased 7.4% to $3.85 billion. Read the release (PDF) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS4myF0EcvFEn_qovdu9XXnab5c7QfPsgbDUtvNgi4_hFg2NDf5tjk2PG5FitWbftzHUI6apvBzdtEoKOkVOmj8NWrEe_H9BFrGW4raNk0nI_2Q3lmoMZknr_Yi37rpw4uWhvIbfKReo98fhaj-g-I2BTp0wqvIci7oLSiKEUjV_PAdLcZWQalhwD3u69CNTFZA=> . On the earnings call, CEO John Wren spoke about digital: "We continue to pursue a multipronged strategy built around the core idea that all of our agencies must have strong digital capabilities to compete in the future. As a result, we are helping in pushing our agencies, where needed, to continue to accelerate the expansion of their digital expertise. We're also consolidating our expertise and knowledge in technology where appropriate." Read the call intro's transcript on TheStreet.com <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS79KJiKd-u_RIcLCLaZK9ZeXnwSWTqH3qyNUjOv7Y1pNScOUMUhiB9ISyA-Ug02A-p6IEk0LqjWy7I6-tkOQBRYUG-Tz_hbDF5doEybLtbxQ7aJBImOfAR6-XyJvkCruMAJDKHc5H5pk1AWwmkE6cxH8UvGEE83Wuz3wcqoMnWApEhRBpE_QrPMcaHeuZrCHhkuYVnjAnEuqvxFXfxrH0RqS6SGNz_kS7qzNXlsFt_4Lw==> . 


Creepless In Seattle


Targeting wireless carriers and media companies, a new Seattle-based company, NFluence, hopes to reach consumers with better deals than what they might get through, say, retargeting. Xconomy explains the the company's mobile app strategy: "NFluence bets that by letting consumers build an anonymous profile that they can control and perfect by ranking offerings and brands, they'll actually get better offers that are less creepy and more relevant." Read about less creep <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS7W1erXENv7I9LZ_4UqObi5kJadqmXkVs3j_l3XpSwCH79fDzSdFCIES6cV4BOY_YCIlqlDkHn_x0p6gJpGfwyz-Aix4DgU88svomaa4kZgj0YQ_Za2U853isgHNdDmNPNvoWCa-EPvQzRMNZEIlnlNyV14kmt2wzeT5hXNgX720JzOjYNfmwIOHcb16nl25cnpo1-T6FNy3woCtNortgC_> . Oh, and NFluence just got a few million to fund the enterprise. Ad tech funding continues. Mobile remains red hot.

CAPTCHA The Bag


Fast Company spreads the love of CAPTCHA advertising to the masses in a quick feature article that highlights how CAPTCHA will go beyond reading some squiggly or distressed series of characters. See how it works with a bag of branded dog food now <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS6nx5mL1N8mP1EdKakFia_W2LlY11ImCR2a0xYpJQzG8jRXJqLrKO_bp18YF5657PeZtDmBS69WBeDm4c5oA_9zYqQk6qzOEq-rC7BYp9T2qflt54rY1aDRqmOT0k7tZUUmS8ZcAUt70s_c0O5I9zbjWlFEIRREna0=> ... 


Loyalty Counts


Bloomberg says that Amazon Prime subscribers, which get free shipping for a year in exchange for a flat annual fee, may not be as numerous as previously thought by analysts - around 4 million currently rather than the 10 million analyst number. Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS5L_c5SAM69SEZN2lEqYV_3pZvwrYZd6-dsrM18Wo8NgBz78uecfR-nGpfYWqMhTZx6Zrx3xBKDochZZTIbBOLgEqOUvPeJvAwW0M6DIv47D5rpo7Y1Vr3f0yxbE32erA0xGZAoS_jtPGQ2JlS6HV0YHSN7Jn0bFcpTqqryXkdtDXs8GK44PLMt6S-xD5AtSAgLtEhRDVFFDC8YR87sK-Wu-BWUKCbXYDXcApv-jTg5GA==> . Not sure that discrepancy is a big deal as Amazon seems to be an unstoppable force. But, check this out on why other retailers should be worried about Prime and still more "Showrooming <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS6LMbojP-x1ZQ8KDu0y5lqBvF3kbkJl-MwIT9gIXsNFcr08Z-cJ8RLRFRuerr8-6lLbHzZeS5D726NP1OxoHC9_MGMSSvNyC0ZbQRbYKX_48LOALv0-hqs7zUlrVVECg2E6Me2LKpPgejPQ5_rGxac1S8flYcRUfRKICGw3e0mxnTt5OrnoX4v2> " in-store. An ecommerce software supplier tells Bloomberg, "A Prime customer is much more likely to start and end a search and purchase on Amazon without bothering to check other channels,' (...) The subscribers spend three to four times more than regular customers." Consequently, retargeting and trade (or co-op) dollars pulsing through a site like Amazon become much more effective, too. 


Billions Not Millions


In a piece titled "What Kind Of Crazy Person Decides A $20 Million Business Isn't Good Enough?" on The Business Insider, Yext CEO Howard Lerman answers the title's question as he discusses his company's decision to continue but not wildy pursue Yext's pay-per-call business. Instead, Yext opted for the data-driven listing biz with billions in potential revenue. Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS7BSua4V8pUMZ2y59dSuj4o6f7lJHwkczEex2JukjyZ9ful2q8Ov-jzOz1UR-Rs-Z8c_F0vYO9enHZvXsZlU6Vwqg9KVgJn-BReIexkR2Lw-eFYyhQXqZkRn9nd4TfOi-5JQMa0kQFf2IsX4J8UcU3aIBkg709ATcypkkwsz5235hR3XWNIPW_KgfbhkyTDYz53EpSvncNsEMsI2GtHYyN1CU6933_z-0Q=> . Yext's VC are likely happy with this decision. 


Mixing Attribution


Is there a difference between media mix and attribution modeling? Some scoff and say "no," it's all the same ball of digital wax. Others... VisualIQ appears to be in the "other" camp as the company announced in a release, its "TrueAttribution 2.0" product it claims "combines media mix modeling and attribution management in a single, hosted software solution." From here, and paraphrasing the VisualIQ view, if attribution covers a single channel and all the points that a customer travels along the funnel, media mix covers how various media channels work together to engage the consumer and figure out what mix of channels works most efficiently for the marketer. Oh, the data... <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS4_roamHJBr5Aq2U4UOR72jtR_JB2RX2UKsp-Yw0oDhEtui_U8Xcv5X4UPJGC81B572gEK6Ftn6rVuxBiiUacdpzICKMko2h3A5imcxVGO-YlPnD8I0nw8s4fxWiX57cVEo0ffftRI38wGOLkr8lyJV0f3BmHkXlerZzJOz-6VL_TQrxY63dpi4a8qsM7Y3OJmWdZeO1yp0kfpAG3tAITeXiaUeIXf2KySx-gVMLrH7jZayjCzTpRrjVgt7ipo1P1k=> . 


Marketing Media


Yieldex CEO Andy Nibley explores big brands as media owner in a think piece on Wired. Half-way through, he tips his hat to the untapped ad potential for branded ecommerce sites: "It would be foolhardy to think that advertising revenue on e-commerce sites would replace the product revenue any time soon. But accepting advertising would provide these sites with another revenue stream and one with very high margins." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109299520074&s=8442&e=001VteoZ5k2MS66M5h5_VaTAxJ6Rlx7krxdJ0ltbTxhD_WDjB7HM_j_AxXP0Oqr5X6Kqm3lbjmXXJNTVcNGSxN9Dydvo59q3aOLUmVPjkw1hWCnjSMJDjDAZEC0recQxwb-yzcgJs2qumHkdsebBeNXz1q8MjSWSGgRoX2UWkuslJixqoZ-1BFssA==> .

Tags M&A


StreamingMedia.com's Dan Rayburn hears that Akamai is closing in on its very own tag management company. Rayburn writes, "Over the past two months, Akamai's been on a buying spree and it sounds like it may not be over. After agreeing to buy Cotendo for $268M and acquiring Blaze for what is rumored to be a $12-$15M evaluation, multiple industry sources say Akamai is in negotiations to buy Chicago-based and privately held BrightTag." BrightTag received $5 million in August. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqI1nXWHI788qoWhf4iWDpWjyTY3dHo4Yt7fQ-dezhA2XS9GBpR65a903ZS3gfOup2bLnPFM-NA2fxV6Qvnc6bUGJMcO91-ckcSzyVc4gnsQJHjNclAEnrlKYa244k-id5WsndrHaRakRnfN9G1GRK7F8PoMNSqqM5s=>  Was it just a bridge loan of sorts until a suitor came along? Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqI4Q8LfIsXwWj_KdgBHtDgjiQIVLToQhUYO3j_sNXTq9Fcrnr6Od4_h5Q1WJaZLEamMvDZhaFOzCDVO4-ttZs_coQ7uelJI1G5oXTuLBPjZD1ro4YxMeoHVPe_fP8Z23t8MANUgKFR3ceYDYr9QxfqeIxgELtWMwHrNlVfOJFh--0fJSJLesrZGht5XEAHgPq7t6FUvjl2621EHycGBP0ZSOERmTcLm4-E9FIAqjtJBuw==>  Managing tags or pixels is another way to lock in Ecommerce pubs. Perhaps Akamai is on its way to building an Adobe-like marketing stack. If so, a few more acquisitions could be coming. How about Akamai getting into the video ad business? DG, which has an HD ad delivery business and MediaMind/Eyewonder/Unicast, is currently selling for  <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqJv7EdBqSp7dkOqf9WHKcYtHLKJBA0TpPKsEqO20Jl0btpewj9Tf9c6YnyQabKuoTu139DuxKvPReYeUhqqeDBxGex66XYdiTXveqj4ikw41MncVIuZJLqk> ONLY $400 million in the public markets. As you may recall, $400 mil was what MediaMind was acquired for <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqKh87xnbjE9LZ9JluDLYfP_FOab5EW8VYfMbLdHnVNtHYMP3HVGP9L4T-5GqUSnAYEU3VEKPxN6eCZKNB5O_GfTyUmM9KFzHCBuO77x3ymy-74uHITcmx06SPVjkuEVDyBj0ckBfTQmijrozR42il8F2bTFqHs8GxQeqREUyuxkKQFP44LmDulk__In7AFR7D_ItPEjqeoraw==> . 


OpenX Sees Profit


Another earnings report from a private ad tech company hit the wires yesterday. OpenX, which has a display ad exchange and publisher ad server <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqKl3mlu72yjwqG6ePeqcfV6j5Cs2d8NgPS7dw0PlqWBFkQ9L_lJ_KZu0fZHux30HBzXqZZpFSKZrdI92QPGj2hrB5cDi9fHaDe_U46I-Ii8Wa3kN81MJPO-6jrrN-Q_diofwK-JqAyst9H4Nfp_jn9Lc2ENeypTerzFy7AZ1R4XGQ==>  among other offerings, announced that it has "achieved a profitable fourth quarter as well as exceeding an annualized revenue run rate of more than $100M." Though it's unclear how much of the annualized $100 million is media costs pulsing through its exchange during a busy, commerce-driven Q4 - for which OpenX may make 20% or so, for example <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqJQdGV3ZdLE39tQnuXWpzQWiiTU8GUWtzGBlviW2jyubiPPxmsTK_PM5hwA9mFFH07SKtoL6tVFceFQ6xxazkek99XBPA64KBxTyCp5sg97Sn6mtat-O57HXcbYjr9XBXhkTbROrwt_vR117vJjS2V-ng59TsVvthsXDjAJuTIdFw==>  - profit is profit whether its gross or net. Read the OpenX blog <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqKfLBcP7qHQzy79HMhJr5mD7m6Tu-yiu8K9NYb_DELrTS9vOo1mUNdC5u1YaTzTvHkg9LZgvZqIb2bRFg0__t3PIaayXpcZuCYpZeP3jm6F1-zyu74zxSZs1j8LhmlwV0fouhLTihZQAzbA-LXGp7KwhC5jChy066liVjyCCDRC0f4QS3DxvRRMsV5VLtH4LXxllrWFDRmsMA==> . In an interview with All Things D's Kara Swisher, CEO Tim Cadogan touches on recent company highlights including the impact of real-time bidding and the slowing growth of search vs. the increasing growth of display. See it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqKXhXYY2PliTpVPY6W42IBF4zDi9HzZ69FwuuWuMtmd2nnhTc9SXf6sDhPdIaxmh1JkeUZ2FjkTiYTCHs5OMeLchKJ1bi5QpkaKOEoLZF5Yc34WG2wPff7vFxS5Ozkeh0eYCdBoSze87WCwQT9Y_naGy9HUzmlUn3_n221DlowdDJSrGxvUxzxfkEsxFwMZ8-1jY-uZMv53zxz54dcsSu155WmO52YhK0dbXtk86Af2xzevaSWgeb9Z> . 


Interest Opportunity For News


News sites are not drinking the data-driven Kool-aid. So says a new study from The Pew Research Center's Project for Excellence in Journalism. According to the report, "...With only a handful of exceptions, the ads on news sites tend not to be targeted based on the interests of users, the strategy that many experts consider key to the future of digital revenue." If you're targeting the news category with digital solutions it may be good news. There's plenty of room for growth <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqLr3XQkujj-nSDbRJ_hrb3nMk-6tFyhIJGlM_lvu4IyqbQnx9vK4QZib7Uk1w4Vas0YhiJU1N3-WglDfllFfPQ8qru2A-eHwQ1G0AzpELy4Vq4_RX9Q65C1K_DEJ-15uNTx3kX3VlHE9IrmsdPyABRXiy72sMcgI-8VOu7bnI1LqQ==>  - including potentially, less lucrative house ads being shown 21% of the time. 


Marin Software Raises


Media buying platform Marin Software has taken in another $30 million to bring its grand total to $80 million <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqKHhCjHMm6_D1X1bZh_3k9SmN_easK5Lu3-CM0WRpJyOWlwtjPK4WNu9fd8c8M10QNqjzPDeSeh3T5gkvMB2xUNme8_XjEm5kZl4vvOYtUorw4qK7Ob8FXa82ucF2xPPam9l5aQelnVpg==>  raised since its inception. The company says in a release that it has doubled its client list to 1,500 in a year. With Efficient Frontier out of the way since Adobe acquired it in December <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqI6ms71LSM4hzC4vQD319WqiVPXgd-5wDpSGf2PgyTIrNV-my3-KeCGQhnIuehqyOR9Spqwi64o-Wc_owQYluJDNQ_mRBNVD6vzZtUkcWvFaQtKkjtN4FRkfRkQhwWZOgsK_w-Du6NoGGWUipVz2icm9NjFO9ou_lylk9qj5jwhsqpCR1iOzE1FYKWKTVjb4o0=> , Marin, Kenshoo and Clickable are looking to make strong cases to their own potential acquirers for media tech and services centered around search and branching into Facebook and display. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqLerBaWB9FXu2n8HAgeRIXtraqs7SGcuvUqlMtqI6ydALILwqgP3IF2t_q_ng_X8FzpO02fQHTRIgSoXigIka6QXiSHsBwLCzT18Euarw7bh-DlZT1IgpgwIifLBdmNDAzY0FHb6tdu3vRbNgXla2krl8UNQEsW5XdDDfDb5y8NLIEeGYMTMVcE3-jeVzH6sMr2ITjyf7l78ZGm0nTmpu2M> . Meanwhile, Kenshoo added another name to its client list as the company said it will provide search platform services to Expedia. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqKCshi8BfTZYTcZwgqOtjO5to7-nEgezkNYNbTP8pH30trKLYdbu0p3aj2DdFRLqvD2wUaQDGWjoaetubHOlKmmtlXl2qUy9czD7x2nT5rNOFdi35qjT0OYG6ZqAseJIY4x0jwBsyzqGGiHY5e-u8mbxCvGkpRZbHPVyh6VuKy0f7j-85JxPgoaP_N0FWExCxL_ewHOVreXAqW3HYRL3jFg2ZplQ3tBcR-_OsZmE14ae_tXPGFmJF_SVz9hiM-mi6eO9jGn4otLheuxoIQ-D7M662mwAR_A47c=>  


Facebook:IBM


On ClickZ, Anna Maria Virzi quotes JWT North America CEO David Eastman during Social Media week in NYC who says, "Facebook 'has become the default tool for lazy marketers who really don't know what to do. No one got fired for buying IBM. Today's equivalent is no one gets fired for marketing on Facebook.'" Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqITe9i5xrJR4bDZYaGUj7PDptkychgIEUsgVpMzUICJBhjCukqV4t6ymNbPESPOtMW-USfl936_bda73YqiKxnGYEdIQHKujZjQ-6ic2fGgp0CiEtBmY_lyPjwlYEpYJVAqK35PuK30yDhxO-91-27GPfK35Iapl_q5jfPPYxcYQN4uriFmvYLW> . There could be worse places for Facebook to be in.

The Data Locker


In a NY Times article, a company called Personal - and others - are betting that it can make serious cash with the management of consumers' privacy needs online. The NY TImes' Josh Brustein explains, "Many of the new ideas center on a concept known as the personal data locker. People keep a single account with information about themselves. Businesses would pay for this data because it allows them to offer personalized products and advertising. And because people retain control over the data in their lockers, they can demand something of value in return." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109287532719&s=8442&e=001LNIlhX3prqLhrtioFyOoC-45FlptEl7gcQgvxSPwie8ZJslOocVqAcE0Nliz3FfcI2y14gznKYS-erhsaojMHEX3sq6xwgHKzC87ZFzPH6kuu955Pi99s-uqyHnuAmJ3yaeJeQMbIGE2XxE_lRaeMIwHjmOHUFDcjZTASD5ER_4eslcLgtVBKeYALM4PgAMOodPFO3BE0OWnpXg5czgsnRb4QChtDJi5Y_WRVefOg2Zn4Yva9s2QLdx1JnYG8bcwsNlCy_g_mv3oj9SpsahhSQ==>

More Money For Mobile


Mobile ad technology company Media Armor says that it has raised $1.5 million in a series A round of funding led by Geoff Judge of iNovia Capital and Ian Sigalow of Greycroft Partners. On the company blog, co-founder Elizabeth Zalman adds some ideas on differentiation for her company saying, "Media Armor is the first in mobile to offer view-through, quantitative test-and-control, and ID-level decisioning based upon a brand's own data set." Yes, there's targeting in mobile. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkCoRn93fxEa5nJO0tQX40WVAB62NJYAaYQ_zb61Bmdx-zb04bZbo383K7apK62bEOMvvLtkMTnW9SG2ceMOZrIzzu06O3dZHr-Ldybovvra63j0gxuB6zj6> . And, read the SEC filing about the investment. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkB0U7CJNJiSkfEyXm3VgfpfW1djU0V0CKLtSIRdCOKkzWkJkKunsYI7KpGqsKJmkOtBBwgxp38yu4F_y6QTH7XG_sVpUjQANBactB_QUQdqRvPnT62S2Av0u5PLXRYSTeoA77jqhd5cKem_6Va_ys1kuNTeIGc6jpEk--4Pdk2al5_Rt5nFmvsZrCRIfYO2TZEnrvXa85yVOg==>  


Agencies In Transition


In India's Best Media Info, Havas Digital coCEO Anthony Rhind is interviewed and he discussed the reasons for the launch of agency brands under the Havas Digital umbrella: "Firstly, we might have a client relationship and we might have the opportunity to work with a client that is a competitor. So, the only way to work is when both the clients are happy - with two different setups. That's one of the reasons for brand proliferation in our agency structure. The second is to enable the development of new capabilities. The best way to accelerate development is to set up a separate organisational structure, give it autonomy, fund it and allow it to grow." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkDI8ixJSoRjhqFfLxLQI9LwXrmGd2l0AnAEER8KOho2-pM6YqiTD-efl2Hsxn9Iua9emioov3Ri5VvS-kydBWgwtpGkQutnXx2Mqy75jtVgcXd5dyXnTX4ATy0Fe8SEKkL1TLdZqCNhy50CJEceKp77NCOMRJu4DJheQxHffT2nDbvNBdZvb1ls2aXDjI_y-TH1RFQkmKQyzfdkQqycSqGO>  - Interesting interview which touches on the agency conundrum of needs: need to service clients any way they please; need to keep up with digital; need to compete with emerging, tech-focused agencies; and need to overcome the traditional agencies' cultural inertia. 


Big Big Data


Apparently inspired by a new report titled "Big Data, Big Impact: New Possibilities for International Development <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkDXHLGzQCEewnKNB_guJ-U6uj4DkT9Q5gMOt9_ItqfT33PwlLFYRX64Cnv2sgu3z8jOo8FChVSvGdGR0y5q1eyTAjtnNTRNC3_O-HxQnxnooyWGIXwlxhs0aswym8Y2TmDceXQhGGIy5mTQ2JB01FsTQmJdxRvmFjhfu0Wji56e89aGTegUQ_yajPMP-83nzEYhvumSMSzzGA==> " issued at the World Economic Forum last month, The New York Times' Steve Lohr pens a feature piece on the world's exploding data streams. Bravely, Lohr offers a definition which reads, in part, "There is a lot more data, all the time, growing at 50 percent a year, or more than doubling every two years, estimates IDC, a technology research firm. It's not just more streams of data, but entirely new ones..." It's big, dammit! Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkC8xKg8Ag6wu19gUz3zd_gTLGUSdhozVN1RDzeLrfdXGSHolnyyf15ySo69-6BKozaNNAhv00yu7e798qhjk5kpiTYhvyatkUBZjrgag9PzPrMUwdMhSLp4GZ395olM6qa7-Y9veb7brei_6Hz-4FM0yKzbC4b3l_V-V4RHKBnME7cXkWyoxfjKRkyBYRDBYI4=>  Over on Ad Age, big data is creating opportunity (and complication) for CMOs as Macy's chief marketer Martine Reardon and Acxiom CMO Tim Suther offer their respective stories in the search for better communication - and selling - with consumers. Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkDVJG_fHUbpUv3IpKR-uurJI_wES6KCy5bOdpYXc6W84cDc6N9rAeGgosajFn8M6aWztDFIHWPgGBOOXaMP5ra5Yzu54czanaoMR_dxn6V2REMwXh8yRyXM-q5R8pKBuM_16dqEg-HOk0cFlpSuqfGZQgUBXtoe_e7Ap03FLglTNpSbrMnV9hOso26LcLPf40o=> .


Yahoo! And Display


On Marketing Land, Greg Sterling comments on a recent report <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkDEoJ2-V3DDAUawj4fm40WI8K-aVGcUc5PqvaloURAH-P_aBf9uh_ijWtKrDgo8W6yb1bJ1Z4rmzZ7oxGsNXbN9oWw-SXpL2On37XRkG3l8KwkU4ZPG1xYNAd3SxktNeq5JV27Bxh21kLTS1qMno0lOR-CTfFNl6myQ3Xz56oGpfS2PwGv568bp>  that claims Yahoo! CEO Scott Thompson may want to move away from "current services" (i.e. display, says Sterling) and move toward new lines of revenue. He writes, "While it's smart to 'diversify' revenue and perhaps to develop more commission or fee-based income sources it would be a mistake to neglect Yahoo's core display ad business. Yahoo cannot simply hope that its ad business can run on autopilot. If neglected, revenue will decline and that decline will accelerate as marketers shift their attentions (and money) to other places and platforms such as Google's Display Network and Facebook." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkCU-N89if3cS2G2ZBGtvrCn2XLLFEZwnMsHJrk3E0QlvQ1hhqbGoIYJOHD_1SPb3NSvOyrQblgNNtYsABl4v59DarFVTE1-z0BoyMBLDZbaQBym3BVDJr-YQOCbazsQxUxJN-e-IxVc7Q9hVBCdWUeGO_--JKeeMineRqAhHaHdk43Xvdl6H3HzfL3EbyTp8sj8ZnNyjpUIVA==> . A tell-tale sign could be whether Yahoo! makes another display ad tech-related acquisition this year. Yahoo! has always been a buyer historically. In the near term, the company remains focused on improving personalization of its content for users writes Ad Age's Jason Del Rey <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkBUdQFc_3Nkj8JCzo8S7KHH2gjI24B4Q1ZckqZ7j40Lo3dLFsL8hHxXCciyWtIpgqC9MgT5IgteYOBSqnp1ZKFeogvX2MTO-f1hOClpk8jq6pN4wGI8sOeWogC9t6iHdgXDPDM6crzctkW0_DwRpz4LRVUhgA55bEdcdF8t3HlWXQ==> . That's only good for ads, potentially. 


Marketer As VC


On Digiday, Brian Morrissey interviews Joseph Jaffe about his latest agency creation called "Evol8tion" which is "solely dedicated to connecting startups and brands. In Jaffe's view, the divide between Madison Avenue and Silicon Valley is as wide as ever." In some ways, it appears Jaffe is advocating a model where brands would take over the funding reigns for startups - to a degree - from the venture capital community. He tells Morrissey, "We believe every viable startup has a brand soulmate. We're not saying they're all are viable. We bet a majority are viable for a particular category or brand." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkComB6DcTJq-h3PAJLRT0ZI4OUyOMF9dlhxvTW2Iwb1tuBsB2xogOB-QQfoB9FTOl_gl4YCDjhgEzT5fHDFLCqwYujb7y-vKcV64bkXXk1bCSI6ZDFYZo6EqCiSSGDKAlJsXWGWgFaY9yzGG4SiVtn9CIOIyD73L0l8W58yu6zhcSRmHiZ6Md0x1z3zg613HOg=>

Privacy Score


The New York Times' Tanzina Vega looks at a new tool for online privacy from Privacy Choice, which is creating something akin to a credit score for websites. Privacy Choice's Jim Brock says in a statement, "For the first time, Web publishers and their users have a way to easily compare privacy practices across the Web. This transparency not only allows people to make smarter decisions about their own data, it also will spur more protective privacy practices by sites and tracking companies, which is long overdue." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkCfYmJsbNM1UkO2eoGHXihaObTeCtEUucAQNP-CndruHGq4RHIWnVCYs-wFy34BuKcaDG1N05iCWmsOAFikVe2k5cYqCm22n3GHB2aE8QHTAYGpnUKrZiB8OS729zvuZ0SnbzWWQI_gKsNlzEcqGnUIkhjLg9QflYStAhly4GeMb3LiNoMo0new5y7oBWgcVDGC5UgdFFgRbg==> . And, visit the Privacy Choice website to see it in action <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkClF7Gu4t61q3e5D1FQ6YFbpm5DkF5fnNIDb7i5oOzvcEJV8q38jwHqlaPSgmz5Uws_PtqNA6_dQfk_qp4tn6QDUlVCsfKJ6R3yVGiiHPncfg==> .


Device ID Strategy


On Friday, news broke that Google will expand beyond the mobile device to home entertainment systems - at least for starters. The Wall Street Journal reports, "Google's entertainment device (...) is expected to be unveiled later this year (...). It's unclear which retailers would sell the entertainment device, which would stream music from Google's online music-storage service and pipe it wirelessly to Google-designed speakers or other Web-connected devices in people's homes, according to these people" Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkBIu32MISqYIz_Is1Yplv3UBoWyVcgyZDFQ4Vzz8DuwkwkzXXlBhbYrGIDYi0X8OH1OaQ-ebShOgL0BwPW47vWLNKmI5AVIXQ8Tm-pg6oGhXQiudiV8njZI1w9HoiI99XCncZeVCgJAEFLfWieN4Y1nTUgoenzBWEMv31zbv2wEy9zCYARzxlxn2_fNfcfyw_P19sierLGO2ehfEVdcrca419uwdSlzKWc=>  And, read about new construction plans in Mountain View from the SJ Mercury News <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkA2R8iA0rGzHw82UF_aTjWJ_prQo1fQmi7cDiPqAUoddJwq-QvTU4StdeoDrg9fZvLPs9qnqEs7c4okFckznKEfZthT6SZlsbb_UuuOsoXGdM9ZhZXkdXrrX10fOSvPvJA=> . Whether it's an Android mobile phone or a new whizbang home audio/video system or a something else, everything emits data streams which can optimize the company's ad and commerce future. And Google needs to combat the developing walled garden, device ID strategy <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkBYB6FZu1W0YlcssJTr72Nk2-ufRwq5JzQ0TUHbncFLp4OEZ8_RwVbWJI2ggIKXcwBYiwWe01iaJc9TEfDWjMyQP_ZhOBA7Ko3yNju-u8vWSBa71X6wMspOBfTcffhZnGJzBX5acSkzuCUu1hgP_2oxloQu6z8-PIE=>  from Apple. By the way, you know Apple has $90 billion in the bank, right? They do <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkDG4vweAU730CBo1FzBUfdt9uaMdgZapYvEIbHNE-o_1jgdL9ukCfMtfOBioM3H9L1pJNVGpoqSiKEpdRAjScPVymNIgrZIJne2jx9MBzE-m71kfRe9ALRokGCJYY7zEa4v2wulq-bGyfMk4DXEJYe6D15oza3GSyY9-TT3gMJ0Wg==> . 


Online Spender Intender


"Holy audience-based buying, Batman!" New research shows that, for certain verticals, the biggest spenders online may be a much older demographic than one might guess. From MediaPost: "According to a shopper behavior study conducted by the Integer Group and M/A/R/C Research, 52% of shoppers ages 50-54 are purchasing health and beauty products online, while 29% have bought food and beverage products online -- more than any other age group." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109274056331&s=8442&e=001jMXHxdXgDkDVGTLF2K1cDNh8KgEMT_4ZAHYns1ZqFidWOGpKv-KQH2nBgdZCtEeGTfMcvW4ZEe0dM1JVIA9oB3BZ5KZAqDbGaVN6EqXjhj0i3w5e5jloroOaSoA2aWKZ0Y9LrHw7u3mM0Zf391KQe5QX2fyBJK3pwlOmBEAyobm6T4RXdCjm_9bUTsx7wkV3TlDUmupuBeC3p2tGWpqYCw==> .

For Friday, February 10, 2012

Today From AdExchanger.com...



*	Friday, February 10, News Round-Up <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAhkeiMJsoBNg9CSHuoE9dcR3BRERKkme9x4HcYqZtY-OrQHKbTFdDt_3Kie08A9cjg-ysSfl0K6Id54rnKWQ3zkcSvCmU53totIYJbNUkZkfRsE2GsXhV9sgbr_0iFEGKrCnZz2g95eKMi85gQ81JzN6l6THouJZ5w=>  (see below)
*	PaperG Sees Local Ads Opportunity With Advertisers Large And Small Says CEO Wong <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAiF4ai5MrGkLKxXe4NmlLb3Fwds_knma3qDWAYfsgDVtqwl-vgkiOVPbou7i9Mghqez3uvYwboHvpDLljMFvFItmqnkkeLmnPIKhnTHcbMQhIUGFzi90LRbOhkSWCflk4F0pYLdR8A27D6aafwh5JHs>   "...real-time bidding (RTB) (...) didn't even exist when we first started the company. For small advertisers, RTB is huge because it allows cheaper and more efficient ad buying at smaller increments." (visit AdExchanger.com) 
*	The Sell-Sider column... Mad Channels for Mad Men by Tom Shields <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAitCu2HQcr-7X1Xoe6749_9e4uXAjBWT7QJYMU6CGLX5FY8Z7ymoUYN96pACUr6k_IQQsEOtQXklDl022O7jTACC2v5IXu41DNsoTZMxmR364qX2t8ycU0X4C6IVqm9zyTHH4m9bfmt-hwmLI15-PGkwA31Z_epHq191F1PFFLYaw==>   "The main challenge with sales channels is channel conflict, as any experienced sales manager knows. The key to minimizing conflict is to create clear lines of demarcation, and up-front mediation capabilities to handle the inevitable ones that do arise. For example, content sales and audience sales are selling the same impressions, just in different ways, so what happens when they try to reserve the same inventory?" (visit AdExchanger.com) 
*	Glam Serves Up New Community Channel With 'Foodie' <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAjYmzHf-8KWNZ_mQj3coAPBnLb67dpCtfBBTyirfZn9e7NBxM5kqJMGm5vUaQ7fF9yfMfGXOZDr-ejAqVPQrmkkDlxzMBthK3gpXbaiYgH5sh48TC0VomZlkx0uQ274rJSWIbKYtWrxtY0FUlbyhxfGR9QVRbv4w7i7zWPhbncrTEZK5-_YzYXz75inccthpyCh6xcmnsBCkw==>   "'We've been asked many times by print magazines to do TV, to create or license Glam's brand and we've always said no - it's not in our DNA,' Arora said. 'What we found was the physical guide book is very important. Eventually, guides will go away, but right now, mobile and print is crucial...'" (visit AdExchanger.com)

Google Testing, Gathering


New "Nielsen-like" panel efforts are being made by Google as the company introduced Screenwise which will be run by GfK's Knowledge Networks. Google may be taking a deeper dive into attribution modeling and/or media mix modeling as, according to ClickZ's Kate Kaye, "The system, which offers people Amazon gift cards in exchange for allowing the company to collect data on their browsing habits, will help Google get a better grasp on time spent on certain websites, which times of day people are online, and other information." What would panels do without gift cards?? Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAhDrcuiongHg4wefysiUtV3CqACQenc60TRTiQJgjxPJgh1cNqwxvEbDvzWUeuWs2IRQhQ9eTbyCLSR6WA3wgRMmRaEjkr5NOeSmtgVe04ycUDeZz0stuyUgU5boOnnCxRJkBNQWdBLimSvNdmPbDTrtU53yDMxVQ-us5x3HWQmVQEX0a2K_tSw>  Meanwhile, more Google data mining is detailed by Digiday's Jack Marshall: "Yesterday Google launched a version of its Chrome Web browser for Android devices, which could provide it with a goldmine of extremely granular user data." Read about the motherlode. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAj6zkTmP-fe5AtQfyvfitWF0eW9fXFS_UgeHtjwq_T8ZMjAnBGOhZZbQSXyJnhEXZAZ1ADOmomsSBspA_mBwn8XyeXAzSVel4-x7mu4gdCIrgtnwGxwQ8OjIRF0EPk3sdOL393fS7hSr1mcNc_RQ-umOKoVdS8UvoqNkrwb62xFvw==>  Need more Google? Read about the latest AdMob "auction enhancements" for mobile on the company's mobile blog <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAg3l0jewaDsY8KbM6WFDgwj50WRIttIENwfs2HYFLAg3RixNe2b5XHuReIu-Vi8l82QqPlwmrurOwwJ_5adzNmMRdb0OW9nd2Ll5x8TLdlpX5bnlbLFqHUW_A6ly1a9eSB9egWt2kytLKq1QEK1dBkW6gTu5WNKw_MLI-9kY8YI34foiiPXud1V>  as minimums appear to be disappearing. 


Time For Brokers, Not Bookers


In Australia's B&T, CEO David Gaines of Maxus pens a think piece on the changing media buying landscape. He's hooked into data-driven I.V. with both arms as he writes: "The biggest catalyst for change is a simple real-time buying platform that allows us to radically change the face of media buying. Buy 80% of all inventory like we buy search. Have brokers, not bookers, plugged into data exchanges and ad exchanges, trading anything except the cream inventory. This will free up a world of time, talent and pressure for everyone." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAj76BV529oxH9J2bJ3hexecg-c-zCrKl74BvYI4jluGnG339rsaaHLYpUkreJgEGiC3PM4aheQNXZUFxpJA2gjnmVc2ToDiINllZKOXOopFLzJVYrBHnd_FRgETfn-0MMljZve7UARFA-wn2hb_BCqz4tjMXrGiPWKR1YyuT5mGPw==> .


Attribution Nation


Clearsaleing says that when clients use its attribution capabilities to understand effects of ad spend - social and display are #winning. Findings from a new company whitepaper: "The presence of social media in a Purchase Path drives higher value orders, in terms of revenue per order ($280), than natural search and paid search combined ($230.07), although it is not the highest traffic channel. When display is included in a conversion path, the average revenue per order increases to more than $206, almost 65 percent more revenue than the overall average order size of $135.37." Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAjxiwYktfmTVPCjz7Lx7RIyRsUHZY_xRqKPUMP4txroevpbkBczu1g3vk1Rr5TPsc_RI5Lj6Go8UlLK6pCsNki76CZKuUHGbM1UAsbJJlDrQtDKli-UDWbMmS2TsB7Ew2pWCXpN9sRDL0P0Uz6cAvZ6BgZeGJG6ykeT7ZF_cXozuOfoYJ6r0E04> . Download, too (PDF - pay with some PII) <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAjPXY5IQsZDAk9af9D6-yHe0_XkUoxztOGQqJibRruILWQq9Ct7ai43KP9s8HoBnULAo3TXCJsyYZkn5EqQvKvGmeEjrZKipr1NRnXwZ46uA7AfwulKqVCFGhCm6JY88EgHckkluWN-Xfjrjh6Rqp5M0i1izot3BXs=> . 


Adding Ad Network


AppNexus has added another ad network client as UK-based Jemm Media (AdExchanger Q <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAgJHH6qpFgBQmuNnPnIjNWgs2uY4OHgGyL11_Ga5NLMCf0kc1REDGS06uEz6wlXbdPCHnQaf_eB7_lBRNH7Ua-UEo4yggbbdsmhV6len5AZW2M_Z9TgcXWaELrsxXA8XWtabY_ItjsorHedBtmhp1w0> &A) announced that it will move "exclusively" to AppNexus' real-time ad platform. The release emphasizes the improvements for Jemm's publisher clients and claims, "Since Jemm Group evolved its business from a traditional ad network to an RTB network, it has seen a year-on-year increase of 300 million additional impressions traded per month, and an improvement in CTR from 0.04 percent to 0.12 percent in just one year." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAjjvedsR2Z2d5je35XYWetEbPRSIoH59lnZWFlMJZ_d9-5ktvYHRZGipWx0Gh8Nmt9rHiquEUmAopygllsPY9wFD0W50gaPCvv_LH2FeKKRnEqEwrb2QWLeQlkurQ6yO5XyeZhDqSci-73gsGkz6NL016XrDLD4e61oigRc-9M9VtUQkK-D2CkHGQwaFHwyk7o=> . 


CPMs Rising


More anecdotal evidence that CPMs are strengthening for some publishers as LinkedIn reported its Q4 2011 earnings. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAh7XfI3SdGEZSkiVwvnWmreqOAFGil55CajmA4u1KVzqddv2LM30yEKLE7w4CIiJN6aPOlUaq1rrcBJUJ2u2lU23BDpsZnfnaA67GT3I1M-u4gK-N52BGmSGytWsmsOaxlF91Bhv6OZ-ZzTr4zarX-1NGiFEg-WIn4=> . J.P. Morgan's Doug Anmuth writes about LinkedIn results, "..demand remains strong across Marketing Solutions, reflective of increasing engagement, rising display CPMs, and improvement in click rates." Read the earnings call transcript <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAhoS87WgEJVfqxzHHxwFoopzR8EoQRkXtApTyBbireopqFD26jrCfqgYC56vbtlj0KRlJZGAWcbA2qYQ71qkGLK2nZig9HMP2LHqWb-xcInYICStib2FqbNh1CKYLr4bVh4LqHv8hlMxH-RASXbO6Iz6AbkiSBT-GS05jyrl-aBEpM5tgcLRmWPILx4gRZGEH30hDtb6_2eANPNbkxk8LXreI1E14702mrOK0oFkvS7lg==>  for all the gory details.

Exchange Efficiencies?


Yahoo!'s Jodie Kahn and Hemant Kapoor trumpet new changes in the way clients are serviced on Right Media Exchange: "Now here's the latest improvement - a significant cut in the time it takes to launch, manage and take down campaigns and publishers on the exchange. How significant? A year ago, actions like that could take two hours to go live; today, they take between 30 and 45 minutes." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAjpTwrmR88cyh5GPKcT2J38myMSN1yWkdFWo0pcw3zgJMik5hJsK7YP5jbtI3KXGxvSyS95gtXCk97zlIiHiarg0Oae2h35GIWVhwPYsygjleZ6G7gV3ovRK6m8-uq-o_JxUMy-jeHeycCaa0SMBT3cW6JX-u95VQsZm7FDuWDAUx462PV_4x9N4VEDFOQ2C7_FhOx9LTS_29TBcF6s5FHg8q6Kjj_O8Lu0Lbp1Dw7e3C6XN5z3hDe7> . 


Prospecting With Ads


"Prospecting" is a term that is steadily moving from the lexicon of the sales team to the ad impression. As the marketer uses programmatic buying to leverage first-party data and search for a target market, the "prospecting" tactic is poured into the marketing analytics machine. On his company's blog, TruSignal prez David Dowhan sees a key to good prospecting technique: "In order for the bottom funnel to grow, you have to feed the top. Just make sure that you're feeding the upper funnel with your highest value prospects." Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAgtxnrEA4yyiayo0CwJSLhuPHLp9eNGc4tWrrlXDL-_vuGoqbjq0A1XSGMFGOc87oy5qiU6u__9wXr2fKj4ZQxg5_Ut9ywAz-Zudpv8lGcIy1xD8pwZnNMVqWFhBODWReJRR8bkC8wvl7jwi9_BBfVYPq18TEYpZpuv-BXpO3l-yqioaQWeg1oT>  


Publisher DMP Talk


Data management platform (DMP) and exchange BlueKai is signaling its targeting the sell-side, too. In a new "DMP for Publishers" whitepaper. One key for a publisher DMP according to BlueKai: Data Portability - "If a publisher works with one or more DSPs and SSPs, as well as multiple networks or exchanges, its DMP should be able to push and pull varying levels of data to and from all of these source." Download it (PDF). <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAgsBglDtRpReDsIhTinRgK6oc4CFhoKHYtGIHCNkHq-liJmI-ekdCFOtTufsmXvGwD_0xBxnRufKYkN64BT5Ks4TVb_I8XOLjnyFN1R7nGBYya6bBvtPAw4rRaKYVVufIcZqhYydGtXksqxgEJroNGq>  This whitepaper follows its more generic, buy-side effort from last year <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAijUQiEkeMjjy5-p3WpSaVg8F-pnGs9NJs30tUjHZWYsOladsE5Ac-_KEf020mgcKa78OjfIk5Kjg9AlchCUUayWdevSnEP_oB55H6EM4O0ug==> . 


Google Wants To Build A Store


Don't forget about the corner store <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAhBn8z_SJ0_4UK3Zkf3f8L2w03gH3wezCf7FHLBJNO7d4ZsnGdv05jwEFSMu3soUoKqS_LVHDghObOF0H-N1P5HF3evfwA7d9spHAZ06ZWPDC9PIOpQlI5BfsHF7B8WpYE8B8JcIhxtHySyaKdLIMHGtlTgqyBMNZE=> : a cog in the online/offline attribution machine. Another big digital company is starting to think brick-and-mortar. Earlier this week, Amazon was rumored to be considering "corner store <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAhF6BLdE_qkd75gZE_ogN__8B3_trbR0i5e8njQ0wZqY3k27DrVggJfRniyW65k2tfFzt6psV0y8CZj48_tEziBCsyU2sAjVZ89zgwRK7PTCSJ4o50GB9drOSn_w4UEoViVS1cwJkFKBveJSOAYyVinfe9cIdSyu8vSShmS_533sgvEiD4FwGCLjM23XwylneMlRRgh8r-r7w==> ." Now, according to Bloomberg, Google is getting into the act in Dublin, Ireland, "The Google Store would be open to the public and sell unspecified 'Google merchandise,' Google's Irish unit said in a local planning application. Located in Dublin's Montevetro office block, the shop would include about 123 square meters (1,323 square feet) of space with an added mezzanine floor extension." Read it <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109260807403&s=8442&e=001COXkXkPXgAizibvREZt6dEISfeqV5x2HhNpuHus-ATMg-LSFr2-89Tkyy8PsWnVgJrwJ1dsNjwVXm98nvYA5C4QoapEE4cQZrJu9QRN5XbR5zArJma55m-Sj3FptzdsOB4gfB8Sy9SWnfIIIDljVry21iIUJANv3TbQMICSXfLr9mQr-lzxax2g_QLx-kICODA8mze5KkJas3p6HY09Huem_jCx69biAezuVrkVRLNc=> .

Akamai Reports; CFO Leaves For HubSpot


Akamai announced its Q4 2011 performance and, though there was no mention of Akamai Advertising Solutions in the release, the company reported net income of $45 million on $324 million in revenues. Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnECbpaey8j8ZzMhHR9zTsQgmpMHJwR0BjBqYabwx-QGP7RmE0r4bPaCGAU3aC-UCDABry2cKoTrgs_UCEmDouG-m4eughhGUNc4dHKfhlmEFrs2HSY22EoJYypSXFpEM1UYvIPsW-OhKGl9KLe05jhMWLvmWD_JQ9mZtpzedZQsF0-YiDN4nKieMJ8UQkmKwEjXLoOVhO-dVvjp7qxxyIFb0TGJGt82n4vKo1aT5pv9Mf0R7A-btfA0xCgKr3prC-Tr3Z7aDRi0NtqfHx-C96hXYzTchoBeGuHlm47qWJlF39g==> . Wall Street had expected $311 million and $40 million, respectively, according to Boston Business Journal <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnEAkwXzpnZ0uNn7hSXq8vew-oURoYrzoNyguqTnJZTACAVlGlTOrpRhYio6r4CkV-y24Mr4L0lwHL7sc8hTLJnwyOVnf-RJ-D4ovUTsYz3pvxfsmix-gaLyvahxsstXmDiDWEvDozTF8a4_JR8GB2czP7RXt2ZjlUAhSJA1f3RIJv9F70mSOPLMu_Z8a8YZuA_LCvXtJVJhZZzeSiwCczYMA9cduGLcGSk-06el8iok__-1m1SLHoui4tg0NPCvOT6kNM0XbqM-Y7nl4RKStmNDxfVfZcFQPOl_rka22OD3wQoidAwql8MKOoS4RWTmM1dU=> . If Akamai wants to add to its ad tech stash, there's plenty of cash laying around. From the release: "Full-year cash from operations of $453 million: year-end cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities of over $1.2 billion." Meanwhile, CFO J.D. Sherman is leaving for the COO role <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnEC1Iesilf7jPh0kc6IbLHy_2ssDG1NClKHLeOodRwm1BTP-qDjOJc-Cbe-V2gZiu2YNkUeLjEfKDyZCiGLKrpfoSMmK6Ujs_yqKOZ0jSdAT-Cc_L-UzO8q2ENJwMnDEPq_-vlMwTaYi7ANiqFf1wsdZyX66RlwCJgMZ6GdLxxyYqWzvTTGvc6upA8mjmqL0PNjHodFv1l3epFUjkPqJrfibCK46iOBhreqzddq-0bPyxWrHmZbEmcwARrYLQVLm6Wsvy3gpVBlqWkZtKxqL4LYYUpre3qBhaFJqZ3A1WbC84EaFEJMoi-cnqbrJmpiLcwR627n3vV658mp_nY2CjSal>  at marketing automation company HubSpot. Don't worry CFO-lovers, Akamai had a new one waiting <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnEAy1U0l_CQCUNA6C56zJ9iJiIXUpd2KpKdVwvxTLhuNXCFqtPUhda3z3AMaXzKwYNHZ1EJb3t0zEfzc9hVNtyB9gJKzdcy-88_KMQpmenh1HfDCE3_yLsKKpQi4Get_lCMvRa2xKsO9bdA94bCn9bSU0bphwBNBFLqepwB6O_xMKDd1yFYL0saY5PmOzsLI2XwKf7kM7_MiDGJZdkj9K1oCfODsePjUB0P-pwO6kQLH5zxlggq4WlQ9K72AozvHMYHvmZJOcjX7pXpBnlHRSURuEmZUaRRnhj8=>  in the wings. 


Accordant Adds CRO


And speaking of Akamai, Accordant Media announced that it has a new CRO, Garrett Vreeland. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnEANFG19yEi8dAUGExC4bNprQprFeq3y4sHa3XU1Dsv2Yt_T3tULcUWfEXclXXO3-_ka0R2Ry1gYIIftc_bht3FmZac06cSLdUBjxltgQICZQjUMtMez_7mzfAuAhdlbA7lHVzV9OoIOUKiHDdPDRugxWOoFPPeJFrtWwHctZUIsZvkLOYOvhd8c8u4D3_YN0btZRLj1ieVN-C-un7_iSfss2Zygt1HN7Ce_tUesgS_7UH0DwjuT2eYr_q3wKPIYS9DcJzeki_YnICT9Juok-ptUUmBib0fyjJToJoN-70XAnhRn2WErhWsYXcnTCiLzRpmqAmIaNF5CynbkyaTb7l4CsW005l6lpPP8474f69FN8YxNI5b5_5DiVbFilKW-Fv_KRnT-WNPvp101VWKpbIsorGB8OciJJ18=> . Vreeland was "Sr. Director, Advertising Sales and Account Management at Akamai following media sales leadership roles at Right Media / Yahoo! and 24/7 Real Media." The startup world appears to be playing its siren song at mature tech companies. Meanwhile, Accordant said that it ran it's 3,000th RTB campaign in Q4 and claimed "bake-off" supremacy. Fighting words! 


Large Pub Love


Mediamind said that it's going to turn its rich media Unicast unit to full-time publisher development, known as "MediaMind Global Publisher Unit." Former Unicast GM James Dillon will head the group as its SVP. The company says Unicast was always 100% focused on publishers and that, going forward, the client target for the publisher unit will be large publishers. Read the release <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnEDsBVSjw6N46LPcp4wBRChpNv6iWIsk2sthmAe5prXqZUVs4UFJRp_UQAdZpJlabgV0B-8A8ey_ODet99S6C0EfnEmHFA_11HzC7EuPGcoUgIMo3XJI_GiOD0x4BRwK1Iefo2gfG2pRG9JUPrkjZNi-j4fOBHTcJk5FRw7EG-UauQpFTuW0bd8lJM21ttiooaBI5kCP8uZIE9N3hVJvyXz1EH5APwbaIKMFleC2Ge6MCLKWHESxAAA6dHIFnXpr7hUr2UInvK61o5Us6BcNkH4z> . For buy-side tech providers and agencies, key, large publisher relationships again appear to be important to both. Large publishers are the new "Belle of the Ball <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnEDtL02VR9xJE-R4ibzBqsQgPyCFHe1aMncnJ08yPcrBBFp1b_Hk0N5GibZ2ENJp9CsDPP_TfsxSO8C3tawNdXbPGO6Iiu2XVd1YfaynsJszWOI2ibplwG3n3OqVoyZhbMhVBSL8uHt_eXXZRCsbA6YVHCtnR6nsRLYMVmQBdi2ohynjjboYriGGzcFmqZJPRDr-sbpCda4eDHYv45CAH4HOV-4FzTx4IFzebrdqrj85BXJKM-M_OPP-KSLEZclQ5dOBZ3BpWrA--Cmz4P1oV7ikudm1aTywLYE=> ." 


DSPs And The Element Level


Demand-side platform Simpli.fi's Frost Prioleau preaches DSPs and retargeting to the search masses on SearchEngineLand. He invokes the words of IBM's John Iwata and says it's time for search marketers to get their arms around unstructured data and start targeting at the... element level (cue The Who! <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnEDffMnnv3oXd-d9pyBUqTzXt2KX90hil77oOxv0xbK90SgntCsyzG_opJ3QaHUs67i3D2XQISPTWYFtS5Rh48_nuVSmaXxM0SrCjxu5GmZfIjspjZD1mbfvq0Fuxplp57b-3HY0o496Lw==> ). Prioleau identifies the levels: "Keyword Level Search Retargeting, Keyword Based Contextual Targeting, Element Level Site Retargeting, and Element Level Behavioral Targeting." Read about the retargeting witch's brew. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnECH20uEIWXGJeW0r5AnJSLW4RZlaOoFU8ULiyd-BG-95y7Z-CxDsJZ87SuMIFz67tArp_PnA89_44V6N2YlVN4VrJx56nN_fjKQ6Pde5o0DjBklw480IzzKBoVEYKoMmQ7g9A0UJxc5Ua_4IckOg6QtS-hK-kxU2rZP0p6cg8e-ESeToSK-BYlmBBD5BDc6JwVyKuoZ6yh9xmlYDCqiIoB1oTz0WHp3evuXJUcCTvm5yOasPccxQinXW0ZKiePjfkt0eNam72KRbPXyAYZUSmuQdacuVuJ3b4pWomq2z8ieAQ==>  


Data-Driven Brands


Another big marketer is reporting a shift in the way it spends marketing budgets. In this case, it has to do with measurement. Ad Age's Jack Neff says Reckitt Benckiser CEO Rakesh Kapoor has outlined a new, data-driven way the company will be tracking its marketing investments: "By 2013, Mr. Kapoor said the company will stop talking to investors about media spending and instead focus on its 'Brand Equity Index,' which covers traditional media spending along digital and social media, medical professional programs and consumer educational programs." Read it. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnEDx7Amx_mYLcDlevUcNhHKlX5oybtvlDHlldiEG_zo3-HpFLWOJqCj7zJHfUqLjpTROrKZr0a6RtUWTC6syUmL__HW1FU5wmwOO2EZpCxiWKrxWTMKQ27pkec_FjvcpSXCoBJiq0kaEdeSRdzWKmTQzdqXDgFZcZCPUmCdKZKCy6yg3QI25zOT71wzXhiNjPyGY5IRhroqBbs3i1aPUEwfFafUVSF49YeTxbugRJVbDJjFn9zXTuh34D9jk_BoLPU5C1GyQxJsUF_N2Bu9aFp4G7zJy2AMSI20vo7EIzSkRkw==>

Digital Mag Ad Metrics


According to Folio, GfK MRI (GfK acquired Knowledge Networks in December <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnEBYXxWuJ8gfLlkcCtzsDfjp2sH7Anu2LxiGYsqR2yQWW-bzyvlot_yi1eHkcWlioa9S3N9oOzHpY3akW4IqvgRI2DhKqCnIx_5cJbCJMHjJR_imM2ZgflHY-P11vm9mDqrP2nj5jAgGnfn1uJpeHpYI5BjsRfZ0Zu4gbaJmaMVdyt24FkVYLWkJyQD7I5eu8xY0OcTcgiiu8BZ3PL9EzdCQC580mMv70PzQOTcnkFvDMPkHOYzTG8kMn_IZ73C7Fs4QW6H9WjWPjg==> ) is rolling out a new ad effectiveness tool for "Tablets, eReaders and in electronic reproductions" from its Starch Research unit. Folio's Ioanna Opidee writes, "Customized metrics will (...) be available, allowing marketers to evaluate the effectiveness of specific components of an ad, such as a video or photo gallery." Read more <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnEDZj7swz9z0OgN7NYEytxbTbOLGd_R9YLjPHjExe22SLsV1B1ip28-Oh_mwV4Vw-hnmTIqERMbPo1JlteiqDPsh7M0JU0z2dLoBu4F6JXtImJGArdKY5Iar460356VV55ONz_SaCLyKH0fkFK03xZNnaHSsyY9QzEgB1DzcheL1Yb_H3XTmTp2SNaN4Te5mMPvhoOGi9xYn7Mz_lSg5xbNEbfLxhaqqr5Zw5_eQ0prGS1V9I4PCRrF4bs9yF9VLAaltlnbDQeO1QBMXGUJTWPf0QyBiK6fYSP4=> . And, read the release. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnEDNsXZsNt8A0EwBF4uxK9nApMajk3rbWIU4Y3jLrnG66EEw2Ybwhm8nbPZrI1Nap2Wsv_M_9CACh7wTKoePmaH6RJvMzt40b6xxe-qAQiCMjkancA-WmNG_rnhBo4P4g-hhPw5uER5JQMHZhLYpc7myWhNexvp2K0Aqd7CDNrlgkadkX7jMUkhi2qCT9D2mQqJaj1fMShsJAGiAm6iRiVSN4dmJ6FD3cwdc009uQsAI4srCbu_lJDJ1PzhYNLdhYEN3BoPxfLgFjZbf_Pz22t97YsGOZea817pKDNvAOd0G4iFaMlrrpCo_dPFvJQlErSNv6DNmpLuzLyrMPiU9gmB5vdiz0GGDKRE=>  


Yahoo! Chair Exits


Roy Bostock is leaving as board chair at Yahoo!. Surely, this is all part of what Yahoo! CEO Scott Thompson agreed to - or required - when he came aboard. BusinessWeek reports, "Alfred Amoroso, a former IBM executive who served as CEO of Rovi Corp., and Maynard Webb, EBay Inc.'s ex-COO, will join the board. Besides Bostock, directors Gary Wilson, Arthur Kern and Vyomesh Joshi won;t seek re-election." Interesting... IBM and commerce-driven Ebay experience. Yahoo! may be preparing for a renewed focus on leveraging its data. Read more. <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnECbGXaFaU6azKlsHX1KnCqPULMOgkEykPu0knAa4NSDQT4prL6EnJwGSQkF7ykNAR6pn7xK3eHzzAPqBoFoSPklksWtV2Y6f2IIh6dQuGKM-nrUsd4ITLzMeQ0nn_qgIrYiB_w8UqJ-lhs3isXbnYWyf7vkkZtyPeUcBhjQLC0h-mgwiFX7EbECA4YCVGuJg9ZPVEIwtmC-wGPlZzciUuTUjBaMkdM5-izt6VdxOu9X98d0D41ObBZraWHPqQ-eLaQ9metEUfDw_Brp8y_VOCfbnNeUhp0A7mLt9cU_yMA3f-b-zVkbmXm4vqaKG3dLAaThzBAT8m-StyVlbn3hD_if>  Wall Street remains captivated by Yahoo!'s asian assets in the meantime. 


GigaOm Acquires paidContent


Guardian's paidContent confirmed that the media trade publication has been acquired by GigaOm. paidContent's Ernie Sander and Staci Kramer made note of the opportunity with the new mothership, "At a time when so many content companies are groping for sustainable business models, GigaOM has a dynamic approach to making money. Its multiple revenue streams extend from site advertising to conferences to subscription products and beyond." Read more on paidContent <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnECaMlAqGDFTK69bZUtz3-AkFOIbdCku3PA_x5OEIuRVVobWLpOA0TAbLNRX21yYCOuFVLyfbkpuWQdbbFvBhCxm-JE1kxXYQG85yQRR_c5itYCrWsz4n3z4nK7nzBLex4JefX1Mhft0vmsLpHkoSOzu9918mWBhx99JYHk8HNOGLZW4ZCC10jkRpJiHHoU06lE_woJShMLFsatzg0eseMSdixcj9Nq-Ek3BqqxaC9ypqox6qvaNdmJz9yw0fBx7QeY-qSrY-58w8pXyh5iR_Ti_> . And, GigaOm founder Om Malik's take on the acquisition <http://r20.rs6.net/tn.jsp?llr=t4t7d7cab&et=1109251535629&s=8442&e=001M8kDY5lJnEAu_iOvl1CCPlfB9xNZ8UDSUDDAp2ievdlhnqF1jD22m9EoDVwabT3fhWUIZRupFQxK7QzicrsUqXNww8AmYoVPGRLQFuFNAV9k_wKWSm7-dnQCKUy4eNv4hZpjwIZPdm2mzJwWyDvL6rAA4P3JpEkGzrYliiUCqnLyhy81wKjGxjMwinGq-aStKzWoNyD0Gd9P03qqLgUfd1-ikuwqh-RWLyaHHS20M1aecWrhvlm5nyuarnjEc1s3gCeiIBaweSQeFVZFLizCy1T2-b6bE9xR> .
